scenarioDescription:
The HD 155193 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 155193 is a star with 1.22 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.76 times its radius. It is located 188.52 light years away from the solar system.

HD 155193 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 155193 system


HD 155193 b

HD 155193 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2021-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 155193 b is 238.500 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 155193 b is 14.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 155193 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 155193, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HD 155193 - System With 1 Exoplanet
